meanings.definition: To cry out loudly in pain or grief.
meanings.sent1: She wailed when she stubbed her toe.
meanings.sent2: The child wailed for his lost toy.
meanings.sent3: The cat wailed dramatically when it saw a cucumber.
meanings.sent4: The sirens wailed in the distance, signaling an emergency.
meanings.sent5: The wind wailed through the trees, creating an eerie sound.

meanings.definition: A loud, high-pitched cry of pain or grief.
meanings.sent1: The wail of the ambulance echoed through the night.
meanings.sent2: The mournful wail of the widow touched everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent3: The wail of the baby could be heard from across the house.
meanings.sent4: The haunting wail of the ghost sent shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent5: The piercing wail of the banshee warned of impending doom.
